## Cosmology with the CMB


::: {style="margin-top:40px"}
most distant observable electromagnetic radiation $\implies$ early-Universe physics

illuminates the Universe's evolution: reionization, structure growth, astrophysics..

:::

![NAOJ](images/cosmic_history.jpg)


## Cosmology with the CMB 


<br>

![](images/FIRAS.png){width=45% style="margin-left:-100px"} ![](images/COBEWMAPPlanck.png){width=62% style="margin-right:-100px"}

::: {style="text-align:center;font-size:0.7em"}
Turner (2022): [The Road to Precision Cosmology](https://arxiv.org/abs/2201.04741) 
:::

:::notes
- spatially flat universe 
- matter responsible for the growth of structure in the universe, radiation (photons and relativistic neutrinos)
    - (baryons, non-relativistic neutrinos, and cold dark matter–CDM) 
- dark energy parameterized by a constant Λ responsible for the accelerating expansion of the universe. 
- on cosmological scales, the universe is statistically isotropic and homogeneous,
- GR
-   and that the behavior of gravity can be
described by Albert Einstein’s theory of General Relativity (Einstein, 1916)
:::

## 1. MUSE Insights on $A_{\rm lens}$

:::::::::::::: {.columns}
::: {.column style="width:52.5%"}

**CMB lensing more lensing power** than predicted by $\Lambda$CDM given BAO.

<br>

**Decreasing** neutrino mass **enhances** structure (measured by lensing).
<br> $\implies$ low $\sum m_{\nu}$ when allowed to vary.

<br>

::: {.fragment}
$A_{...}$ scales $\Lambda$CDM lensing power that is used to predict:

- $A_{\rm recon}$: reconstructed **lensing** spectrum

- $A_{\rm 2pt}$:  **CMB** power spectra

- $A_{\rm lens}$: if $A_{\rm recon} = A_{\rm 2pt}$
:::


:::
::: {.column style="width:47.5%;margin-top:15px"}
![](images/muse_lcdm_A2pt_Arecon_contours_triangle.png)

## Cosmology from CMB Secondaries

Foreground signals also contain rich cosmological information.

:::::::::::::: {.columns}
::: {.column style="width:50%"}

<br>
<br>
<br>

## MUSE Algorithm

:::::::::::::: {.columns}
::: {.column style="width:60%"}


<br>
<br>

Marginalize over CMB $f$ and lensing $\phi$ <br> maps/pixels to determine parameters $\theta$:

::: {style="margin-left:-320px"}
$$
\mathcal{P}(\theta \mid d)=\int \mathrm{d} f \mathrm{~d} \phi \, \mathcal{P}(f, \phi, \theta \mid d)
$$
:::

::: {.fragment}
Algorithm similar to simulation-based inference (SBI) with semi-analytic compression statistic.
:::


:::
::: {.column style="width:40%;margin-top:-70px"}

![](images/muse_MAPs.png){width=1000px}

:::
